title: Online Language Assessment Preparation and Practice (Czech A2) 2025
description:
These asynchronous courses are designed for EDUC students utilizing self-guided activities to prepare them for language exams in English, German, Hungarian and Czech ‚Äì four of the languages represented in the EDUC network of universities. Students enrolling in the course will have opportunities to practice developing their receptive (reading and listen) and productive (writing and speaking) skills in these four languages, working through typical tasks found on language exams. These courses are built around the European Consortium of Languages (ECL), which is the University of Pecs‚Äô foreign language exam system offering ECUC students and others across the EU and aboard language exam certificates in more than ten languages.

This online language assessment preparation course in Moodle will be structured around six learning modules for the target language and CEFR level: 1.) Introduction to the ECL Language Examination System at the University of Pecs, 2.) Reading section of¬†assessment, 3.) Writing section¬†of assessment, 4.) Listening¬†section of assessment, 5.) Speaking¬†section of assessment,¬†and 6.) Online Practice Exam.¬†In Moodle, participants will work through a series of pre-recorded screen casts of Google Slides and Prezi presentations to learn more about¬†the content they can expect to encounter on¬†the ECL language exam. They will also have access to PDF files, sample language¬†assessments, and¬†additional online resources to assist in preparation.¬†All modules will include¬†asynchronous¬†resources for EDUC staff¬†and students¬†to work through the productive and receptive skills independently and at their own pace. However, the modules will include¬†the following¬†recommend time¬†(Total Time: 6 weeks/22¬†hours)¬†to spend on each language learning task¬†in order to successfully prepare for a language assessment¬†in the selected EDUC language.¬†

title: BRSS Creative product design: towards a more sustainable society through research
description:
#### Learning objectives

The Blended Research Summer School will explore the topic of product design engineering  with a focus on sustainability and creativity to develop new product or systems solutions for society and people. At the same time, the programme will focus on building confidence in various stages of research, including understanding existing literature and background, enhancing writing skills, delivering oral presentations, and improving communication abilities. The Summer School will also equip participants with English language skills tailored to research and product design engineering contexts.

#### Lectures included in the BRSS
- **Online part:** Introduction to the topics, English for research, Practical tips on research, Options after the PhD, Creativity and Artificial Intelligence. During the online phase, students will begin to work on a group project with the support of the lecturers.
- **In-presence part:** Sustainability and creativity in product design, English for product design, Plastics design, Materials science, Creativity workshop, Waste management, Virtual Reality in product design and product perception. 
- **During the onsite phase**, students will continue developing their projects, both in dedicated sessions and independently, leading up to the final oral presentations at the end of the course. Technical and cultural visits will take place. 

#### General objectives
- To give a comprehensive vision of product design engineering and the role of the discipline in society and in the environment. 
- To enhance knowledge of the different product design sub-disciplines. 
- To gain confidence in research and in English skills for academic purposes.

#### Virtual part objectives:
- To be introduced to the topic of product design engineering (if multidisciplinary group).
- To conduct independent research analysis and work from a given topic. To work in a group.
- To improve their English skills for academic purposes.

#### Onsite part objectives:
- To present a research project (oral presentation).
- To enhance English for product design engineering,
- To deepen their knowledge about the different product design sub-topics and their role in research (creativity, eco-design, products end-of-life, sustainable plastics, user experience, etc.).
prerequisites:
#### Learning offer addressed to

-PhD/Master students.
-Preferable background disciplines (but not restricted): product design, environmental/sustainability topics, other engineering, graphic design.
-Students from other disciplines with genuine interest in the topic are welcomed.
-Valuable to be doing research, aim to start researching or having interest about research.
-B2 English required.

title: Critical Methodologies
description:
Critical methodologies engage and problematize global approaches in social sciences, humanities, and cultural studies in dialogue with perspectives from the margins on research practice across disciplines and in cross-cultural contexts with regional and local cases in the global South and beyond. The course provides insights from research in interdisciplinary environments such as studies of urban space, critical heritage, migration, human rights, religion, music, and diversities. 
The course provides PhD students with new insights into critical methodologies aiming for dialogue across structural, physical, and disciplinary boundaries challenging binary thinking by learning and unlearning and thinking otherwise. Southern and decolonial perspectives imply a dialogue and critical interrogation of the politics of knowledge and research methodologies in various contexts across the world. We reflect critically on the politics and ethics of knowledge, research design and impact, inequalities, power relations, coloniality, intersectionality, positionality, reflexivity, and the unforeseen and failure in doing research.  

## SKILLS 
The candidate: 
- Formulates theoretically grounded problems using critical methodologies to plan and carry out interdisciplinary research in their own field at an international level. 
- Employs and makes use of critical methodologies across social, political and cultural contexts, challenging established knowledge and practices in a way that qualifies for international, peer-reviewed publication. 
- Can identify and analyze the need for knowledge development and change in established research approaches within the cross-cutting areas of social sciences and humanities. 

## GENERAL COMPETENCE 
The candidate:  
- Critically discusses and evaluates methodological questions in their own and others‚Äô projects, communicating such evaluations to peers and the academic community. 
- Can disseminate research results on critical methodologies and interdisciplinary research through national and international publication channels where academic production is scrutinized by critical peer-reviews. 
- Can identify knowledge gaps and reformulate research questions in innovative ways that contribute to new thinking in critical methodologies in ways that are relevant to their research area and relevant fields of practice. 
- Can identify ethical and political challenges in methodological approaches, conducting research with academic integrity. 
- Can manage complex professional tasks in research, identifying struggles in dominant approaches and contributing to new thinking in research methodologies.
prerequisites: This course is suitable for PhD candidates in the Humanities, Educational, and Social Sciences as it will strengthen their analytical ability to work with critical methodologies. It is also open to students with a Master‚Äôs degree in such areas.   Candidates from other relevant fields are also eligible. Candidates from EDUC universities must apply at their home university. Scholarships are available for selected students.
details:
The course is blended. 
It begins with digital lectures and seminars introducing the main research approaches in the field.
 In introductory seminars, PhD candidates work on their research projects with fellow students and academic staff. 
This is followed by an intensive five-day in-person week of lectures, seminars, and multisensory workshops at the University of South-Eastern Norway providing empirical research experiences in the field. Students will have the opportunity to present their own research in seminars, relating the research perspectives introduced in the course to their own research topics. The course will include participatory, decolonial, and multisensory workshops.

further_information:
### This course comprises: 
- Lectures with discussions and writing tasks ‚Äì both digitally and in-person. 
- Seminars with presentations, featuring discussions about the literature and the PhD candidate‚Äôs research topic 
- Obligatory reading and preparatory work prior to seminars and lectures. 
- Cross-disciplinary workshops drawing on artistic methods 
- Multisensory small-scale fieldwork in various locations and local communities 

### Course requirements:
- Research abstract (max 1500 words) of students research project, including a detailed plan of their research methodology;  
- Participation in online group work;  
- Seminar presentation of their tentative research methodology (in person USN Drammen)  
- Participation in cross-disciplinary workshops and multisensory small-scale fieldwork  
- Active participation in the course‚Äôs seminars and 80% attendance. 
- Successful completion of the course is contingent on approval of the digital and in-person components and submission of the essay (examination).  

### Exam: 
PhD candidates are expected to write a short essay where they relate critical methodologies to their PhD research topic (3000 words max). The essay is a take-home exam. The essay must demonstrate that the candidate has achieved the learning objectives as described in the course description. It must also conform to academic standards regarding referencing and citation practices.
summary: Drawing on critical, decolonial, and participatory perspectives, this course discusses methods in practice related to decolonizing research and thinking otherwise.

title: E-tandem for Staff
description:
The programme pairs two administrative staff members from different universities within the EDUC- alliance to practice a language of their choice, enhancing intercultural communication skills in a friendly and professional environment.  

## Goals 

The programme aims to equip staff with the necessary skills to communicate and work in a foreign language within a multicultural environment, while also providing an opportunity to engage in a common objective with EDUC partners using digital communication. Participating in this programme may help with planning for physical staff mobility or staff secondment, career advancement, and skills development in general.‚ÄØ 

## Organisation 

Staff from two different universities will be paired up to meet online at least 12 times between March and October 2025.
prerequisites:
**Selection criteria will include:**

Motivation 

English level A2-B1 (to communicate with the tutors) 

Compatibility with other candidates
details:
The programme consists of online tandem meetings - 12 hours in total, including 3 hours with a tutor.  


Total minimum: 12 hours (mandatory) 

 

Up to 8 participants from each institution will be selected, with 1-4 participants chosen to join a waiting list.
summary: The EDUC E-tandem Language Programme is a tool for the development of language skills and intercultural competences.

title: Understanding the workings, expectations and challenges of an editorial board for a scientific journal (French)
description:
#### Learning objectives

Before submitting a scientific article to a journal, you need to understand how the editorial board (or any other decision-making body) acts, on what basis, with what stakes, according to what objectives. Although they are grouped together under the same heading of ‚Äúscientific journal‚Äù and are governed by the same basic rules (e.g.: anonymized articles are evaluated by anonymous reviewers), these journals operate in very different ways.

title: PSYCONET: Psychopharmacology of Neuropsychiatric Diseases
description:
The PSYCONET International Learning Program offers a unique opportunity for university students (Bachelor's or Master's level in Pharmacy, Medicine, Biology, and Psychology), PhD candidates, and selected professionals to deepen their studies in the psychopharmacology of neuropsychiatric diseases and acquire skills in this field, with a focus on gender differences on the role of neurodevelopment.  

The course, taught in English, will be delivered online from March 19th to October 1st, 2025 (for a total of 33 hours of meetings). It aims to provide students of the EDUC alliance with activities that foster the exchange of expertise within the alliance in the fields of basic and clinical sciences, including neuroscience, psychiatry, neurology, neurosurgery, neurotoxicology, as well as in the field of pharmaceutical and medical devices techniques.
prerequisites: The course is open to all students (Bachelor's or Master's level in Pharmacy, Medicine, Biology, and Psychology), PhD candidates, and selected professionals with a good level of English proficiency (minimum B1).
group_target: Bach. students year 1,Bach. students year 2,Bach. students year 3,Master students year 1,Master students year 2,PhD,Postdocs,Researchers,Teachers
further_information: The program is coordinated by Prof. Maria Antonietta De Luca from the University of Cagliari, together with colleagues from Unica: Nicola Simola, Giulia Costa, Nicholas Pintori, Francesca Caria, Donatella Rita Petretto, and Cristina Cabras. It also benefits from the contributions of colleagues from Masaryk University, P√©cs University, Rennes University, Jaume I University, and Paris Nanterre University (more details are available in the attached program).
summary: Join the PSYCONET International Learning Program to explore psychopharmacology, neuropsychiatric diseases, and gender differences. Open to students, PhDs, and professionals‚Äîapply now!

title: TESE Days 2025 - Talents and Entrepreneurial Skills in Europe Days
description:
Are you a PhD student eager to expand your professional horizons? The TESE Days, organized by the EDUC Alliance, are here to help you transcend disciplinary boundaries, cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset and build bridges between academia and the professional world. ‚ÄØ 

 

**Where:** University of Rennes, IGR-IAE School of Management, France 

**When:** June 10‚Äì12, 2025 

**Who can join?** 

All PhD students‚Äîfrom first-year researchers to those nearing completion, regardless of your discipline. 
Whether you're just beginning to explore career opportunities or looking to refine your transferable skills, the TESE Days are tailored to your needs. 

 

**Why join the TESE Days?**

 

- **Explore diverse career paths.** Imagine a future where your transferable skills unlock exciting professional opportunities. The TESE Days are designed to expand your horizons and accelerate your career growth.  

- **Build an international network.** Connect with PhD students, experts and professionals from across Europe and beyond. With participants from eight European partner universities, this event provides a platform to establish an international professional network. 

- **Develop your transferable skills.** Enhance your transferable skills, take part in professional role-playing scenarios, and cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset‚Äîqualities highly sought after by employers worldwide. 

 
**What‚Äôs in it for you?** 

- A collaborative experience that brings together PhD students across disciplines and institutions. 

- Opportunities to pitch your profile to professionals and consultants, improving your presentation skills. 

- Workshops bridging the gap between academia and industry, preparing you for diverse career opportunities. 


**We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you to an event that will shape your future!**

Seize this unique opportunity to be part of an exclusive group - 40 spots are available for participants from across Europe. 

 

**Ready to Take the Next Step?** 

 

Join us from June 10th‚Äì12th, 2025, at the University of Rennes, France, and unlock your full potential! 

 

**Contact Us** 

 

For questions or further information, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to the EDUC team at [educ@univ-rennes.fr](educ@univ-rennes.fr).
